strings: <Cap><leader> discovers a new recipe for the alchemy pot!
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3>
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3> + <Cap><string_4>
<se_def>*: I don't know. We started off the same, you and me, <hero>. And now all of a sudden you're chief of the guard! I can hardly believe it!
<se_def>*: Still, I suppose you deserve the promotion. After all, you did defeat Rhapthorne and restore the castle to its former glory!
<se_def>*: The Princess's wedding is taking place in Savella Cathedral, isn't it?

<se_def>*: And you're going to be acting as her bodyguard on the way there, Commander?
I had hoped I might be able to see the wedding myself.
<se_def>*: Ah, Commander! I believe everything is ready.

<se_def>*: The Princess is waiting for your escort.
She's in her chamber on the third floor.
Commander, would you do the honours?
<se_def>*: The King has gone on ahead to the cathedral, apparently.
<se_def>*: No doubt the father of the bride has a lot to discuss with his daughter's new father-in-law.
<se_def>*: The Princess's safe delivery to the cathedral is in your reliable hands, Commander!
<se_low>*: Oh! Haven't you left for the cathedral yet, <hero>!?
<se_low>*: I've gotta say, I never thought you were the type to go and defeat that Rhapthorne and save the world!
<se_high>*: Is the Princess going to go away once she's got married, <hero>?
<se_high>*: That's not fair! I don't want her to go away! Why can't she just stay here after the wedding!?
<se_high>*: What with the curse, and that gruelling journey she had to suffer, poor Princess Medea's been through such a lot!<page>*: She deserves her fair share of happiness now!
<se_high>*: I hope this Prince Charmless doesn't live up to his name! Just so long as he makes the Princess happy, that's all that matters.
<se_def>*: Excuse me, Commander, but where are you going? I believe the Princess is waiting in her chamber on the third floor.
<se_def>*: You won't find her here.
<se_low>*: Who on earth would have believed the treasured sceptre was the seal binding Rhapthorne's soul!?
<se_low>*: I never heard of such a thing! Even in legend.
<se_low>*: If there ever was a legend about it, it must have been forgotten a good long while ago.<page>*: By the time you get to my age, you've heard most of them, I can tell you!
<se_low>*: I wish one of my swords had been used to slay Rhapthorne.
<se_low>*: If I hadn't been under that blasted curse of thorns, I'd have made the strongest sword ever known!
<se_def>*: We will ensure the safety of the castle in your absence, Commander.
<se_def>*: You needn't worry. You can put it out of your mind, and focus on escorting the Princess.
<se_high>*: Well! If it isn't <hero>, my favourite young man! Can I help you with something?
<se_high>*: Oh, of course! You must need some food for little Munchie. Well I'm sorry, but we're all out of cheese.
<se_high>*: I don't know how that mouse keeps going! How old is he?<page>*: You've had him ever since you were a young lad peeling potatoes with me here, haven't you?
<se_def>*: Ah, Commander! Have you not left yet, sir?
<se_def>*: The Royal Minister is waiting for Princess Medea and yourself downstairs.

<se_high>*: I'd never have believed it when I saw your scrawny little self turn up in the castle here ten years ago!<page>*: Who'd have thought you'd be the one to rid the world of the Lord of Darkness!
<se_high>*: You've turned into a fine young man! All of us here in the castle are very proud of you.
<se_low>*: Though your journey will be a short one this time, I'll pray that nothing untoward befalls you.
<se_low>*: May the Goddess be with you every step of the way!

<se_low>*: Ah, there you are, <hero>! I asked one of your friends to give you a message.
Did you get it?
<se_low>*: Then if you wouldn't mind fetching the Princess as soon as possible. She explicitly requested that you call for her.
<se_low>*: What!? You didn't!? I don't know, that oaf of a man isn't worth his salt!
<se_low>*: I asked him to tell you that Princess Medea is waiting for you in her chamber. You are to escort her to me here.
<se_low>*: She explicitly requested that you should call for her. Would you mind awfully going to fetch her straight away?

<se_high>*: What's this Prince Charmles like, then?
I expect he's a most charming man!
<se_high>*: I was so excited about today, I couldn't sleep!

<se_high>*: It's the first time I've ever been on holiday, you see!<page>*: Oh, dear me! I mustn't call it that!
I'm only going as the Princess's attendant.
It's not a holiday!
<se_def>*: I hear it's a long way to Savella Cathedral where the wedding will take place.
<se_def>*: It was Dhoulmagus who cursed Trodain, wasn't it? I was absolutely stunned when I found out.
<se_def>*: All the time we were under the curse of those thorns it felt like one long, awful nightmare.

<se_high>*: Oh! It's so unfair! I can't believe it!
Why don't I get to go with the Princess!?
<se_high>*: I could be her attendant! I want to go with her! I want to see the wedding!
<se_low>Yangus: Eh, is somefin' wrong, guv? How come you ain't gone to get the Princess yet?
<se_def>Angelo: I heard old Trode went on ahead to the cathedral.
<se_def>Angelo: I could hardly keep a straight face when I saw him! He doesn't really look much different to when he was cursed!
<se_high>Jessica: I know it's only a short trip this time, but I'm so happy to be travelling with you all again!

<se_high>Jessica: Who are those bimbos all over Angelo?
You'd think they were made of glue,
the way they stick to him.<page>Jessica: You'd never catch me behaving like that.
I get dressed before I go out!

<se_high>Red: Ain't the Princess waitin' for ya?
You don't wanna keep a lady waitin'.
We 'ate that.

<se_low>Morrie: I was wanting to say ciao to the Don Toad,
but I am missing him by the bat's whisker, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Va bene, it is not a matter. If I am with you, ragazzo, I am sure I will run over him at the cathedral.
<se_high>*: Oh, you're <hero>, aren't you? That's right, you helped Angelo defeat Rhapthorne. He said he couldn't have done it without you.
<se_high>*: Guess what!? I'll be coming along with you all too! I'm not letting this one go now I've found him!
<se_def>*: It was that Dhoulmagus fellow who cursed Trodain with thorns, wasn't it?
<se_def>*: I suppose dressing up as a jolly jester was his way of getting into the castle to steal the sceptre.
<se_low>*: The body of the Lord of Darkness was hidden inside the holy statue in Neos all along! It's like a sick joke!
<se_low>*: I went an' prayed to that statue once. Urgh! D'you think that means I was really prayin' to the Lord of Darkness!?
<se_def>*: Will you be leaving us for Argonia as well, once the Princess is married?
<se_def>*: I don't know how we'd manage without you here. I do hope you'll come back to us once your escort duty is done.
<se_high>*: Oh, my! I can't believe it! The chief of the guard came and spoke to me! To ME!

<se_high>*: Are you going to the cathedral now?
Take care, sir. We'll all be praying for your
safe return.

<se_high>*: Ah, <hero>!
What a pleasure to see you!
<se_high>*: I was just reminiscing about Princess Medea and all the times we spent together.
<se_high>*: And you! I've got plenty of memories of you, too!
<se_high>*: It was ten years ago now that you joined us here at the castle, wasn't it?
<se_high>*: You were rather surly at first, if I remember correctly.<page>*: But life around here soon brightened you up. And now look what a fine young man you've become!
<se_high>*: Sorry! Listen to me! I should think you need to be getting along, don't you? The Princess is waiting for you.
<se_high>*: Oh, dear me! I've been chatting too much, haven't I!? You should be getting on your way. Isn't the Princess waiting for you?
<se_high>*: You'll be sad to see the Princess leave, I expect. Yes, of course you will.
<se_high>*: No one gets on better with her than you, <hero>.
<se_def>*: I still can't believe the royal treasure upstairs was the same sceptre used to seal away the Lord of Darkness!
<se_def>*: I had no idea the magic circle was part of the sceptre's magic seal! I thought it was just there to keep thieves away!
<se_def>*: The Princess loves to play the piano, but recently all she plays are sad tunes. I'm starting to find it a bit depressing, actually.
<voice_0x010016E9><se_high>Princess Medea: I'm sorry, I just can't relax. Is it time yet?

<voice_0x010016E8><se_high>Princess Medea: Oh...
Well we can stay here for a little longer then.
<voice_0x010016EA><se_high>Princess Medea: I asked the Minister to have you call on me so that we could take one last walk through the castle alone together, just like old times.
<voice_0x010016EB><se_high>Princess Medea: I know it's not quite time yet, but I wanted to say goodbye to you properly. To thank you for everything you've done.
<voice_0x010016EC><se_high>Princess Medea: The times I've spent here in Trodain Castle, with you, will be memories I shall treasure for always.
<voice_0x010016ED><se_high>Princess Medea: I have to marry the Prince of Argonia to fulfil my royal duty. And you have to<endash>
<voice_0x010016EE><se_high>Princess Medea: Please continue to serve my father and protect Trodain. Just as you always have.
<voice_0x010016EF><se_high>Princess Medea: ............

<voice_0x010016F0><se_high>Princess Medea: So then, shall we go?
It won't do to keep people waiting too long.
